page.title: 05Royal Observer Corp Post
page.content: When we visited the Royal Observer Corp post close to the old Lewes Race Course we had to go down a ladder thirteen feet below ground.We were surprised how big it was.Mr Holford, who showed us around,told us that the post was built of concrete and measured 17 feet long, 7 feet wide and 7 feet high.It also had a 4 feet square toilet.It was built in l960. The post could hold a crew of three and there was enough food to last them 63 man days.The food was in a box and included lamb hot pot,chicken roll,chocolate nutty bar and chewing gum.This would enable the three man crew to stay underground for fourteen days.The post had its own petrol electric generator and an air pump to filter and exchange the air in the post. The Lewes post is connected by land-
